name: Sunshine Suites Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a really nice stay at Sunshine. The room was always clean. We enjoyed the fact that you could cook at least one meal per day to save money- since the island is very expensive. Fosters Food Market is right down the street.
reviews.title: Great Stay at Sunshine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definitely recommend renting a car. It was great to see the island this way. If you don't rent a car- use the bus system as we heard that the taxis are very pricey. They charge you $2 CI pp to go along Seven Mile. Just tell them where to stop and they let you off.
reviews.title: Very good hotel if you are not looking for a resort
Best Hotel value in Cayman
reviews.text: Sunshine Grill was GREAT! We never had a bad experience there. Drinks were great, and the food was NOT pricey considering the prices of all the other restaurants we experienced. We NEVER had to wait long for our food and neither did anyone else that we saw. The breakfast that is included definitely fills you up, but if you want a change their buffet was delicious as well. ($6 US pp)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would recommend buying liquor at the duty free shop at whatever airport you go to before getting to Cayman. Our $14 dollar bottle of rum from the DF shop was $60 in Cayman!!! You are allowed to bring 1 liter per person.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't mind crossing the street to go to the beach. Just look right first and people will stop for you if you are waiting in the middle turning lane.
reviews.title: We've stayed at the Sunshine Suites many times and it never disappoints!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Sunshine Suites for a week in July 2011. It was our first trip to Grand Cayman Island and we loved this hotel!! The only downside is that it is a bit of a hike to the beach, which became annoying in the blazing heat while we carried a cooler, chairs, beachbag, snorkel gear, etc. But other than that, the hotel was the best we've ever stayed at. Grand Cayman Island is a VERY expensive island, and the free breakfasts, plus the $250 credit we received toward meals at the Sunshine Grill really helped us maintain our budget and feel like we got amazing value for our money. It ended up that we really only needed to pay for one meal per day (which we cooked in our room)! The staff was so genuine and friendly, like they really wanted to help in any way they could or with any questions we had. We were always greeted with a smile and professionalism. We've traveled to several Caribbean islands and been to many hotels, and we have never had better service. The pool is pretty small so I wouldn't recommend this hotel for pool people. The room and grounds were immaculate. The free breakfast was delicious; anyone who complains about it is probably a very difficult person to please, in my opinion. Make sure you rent a car for a day and explore the island, and definitely take the jet ski tour to stingray city- best excursion ever!!
reviews.title: Amazing value for your money!

reviews.text: Great location and beautiful well maintained property!! Front desk staff very friendly and always accommodating! We were even offered a cold bottle of water when we checked in!! Rooms were nice size and kitchen was perfect for meals in your room. Fosters Grocery store is just down the street!! Restaurants are very expensive!!the complimentary breakfast at Sunshine was cereal and fresh baked muffins/toast and usually some fruit. They do offer a hot breakfast buffet for about $6-7. The beach is a short walk and Sunshine has beach chairs and beach towels available to guest. There are no umbrellas at the beach or much shade so plan accordingly!! We traveled with our teenage boys and found plenty to do during the daytime but not much available in the evenings after dinner. Overall we had great time!!!
reviews.title: We loved Sunshine Suites!!

reviews.text: My husband and I have chosen an excellent spot for our guests to stay for our wedding. Everything from the grounds to the service to the food were outstanding. Everyone was impressed and pleased with our choice. It was the perfect location to have everyone together. We plan to return every year for our anniversary.
reviews.title: A great choice for your stay in Cayman

reviews.text: The food at the hotel restaurant is great and there are restaurants nearby that are also very good.
reviews.title: Great for a budget trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is not on the beach, but within a very short distance across the street. There is no crosswalk, so one must be quick and vigilant to get across.
reviews.title: Grea Value on Seven Mile Beach
Great Grill!
reviews.text: We stayed at a different hotel down the beach, but came back to the Sunshine Suites Grill multiple times. The food was excellent... best fish tacos and best burgers we have ever had, and the grill was by far the best meal value we found on the island. Our server, Kendal (with only one "L"), was great and she made us feel right at home.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely come back to Grand Cayman Island and Sunshine Suites Grill in the very near future.
reviews.title: Great Budget Choice

reviews.text: If all you need is a clean, comfortable room within easy walk to the beach and close to all amenaties this is a great option. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and the grounds are well kept. As other reviews have said, this is not the resort experience you might get at the Westin or Ritz Carlton but the price is likely to be a fraction of those. The rooms are basic (think Days Inn) but have a kitchenette and fridge and there is laundry on-site. They are well kept and very clean. A/C works great. On site resturant is one of the best bargains on the island for lunch or dinner. The free breakfast is is fine if you need to grab juice, toast and a banana but don't expect more. For an additional $5 there is a full buffet but we didn't try it. Also, breakfast doesn't start until 7am so Divers on an early start may have to miss or grab and go. Only thing missing for the price was the lack of private balcony to sit out and relax after returning from diving. The pool although nice and clean was usually occupied with children.
reviews.title: Meets Expectations, but a few small details that could be improved on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary, if you are travelling for diving and only need a cheap, clean and comfortable place to stay check this out. If you are looking for a resort you don't have to leave, look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay

reviews.text: Sunshine Suites does a great job at providing a safe, happy, hotel experience. It doesn't offer the 'Beach Resort' experience like the Westin across the road, but if you want to travel on a budget the hotel with the kitchens etc and the lower rate than the beach hotels makes this an excellent choice. The restaurant is popular with locals which makes it difficult as a guest to get a table. I think it would be good for the menu to be available in the rooms and guests to order from the room, even if it is just for pick-up...delivery would be good. The pool is in the middle of the outdoor dining area, so not that private if you want to suntan or have a swim. For me the area that disappointed was the housekeeping. After 3 days of not having the shampoo etc. topped up I had to ask for it, the bathroom had a strong smell- as I was here for almost 2 weeks- I took the initiative and purchased air freshners at the grocery. They provide both decafe and regular coffee, the regular coffee which was used was not topped up everyday which meant i had to wait until 7 a.m. to get my coffee downstairs. One morning I left a cereal bowl in the sink when I went to work. I didn't expect house keeping to wash it, but it would be a good service, I think the hotel should look at including it in the housekeeping. Instead, my neatly organized stash of snacks etc. were moved on top of the stove and the draining board was put out to communicate 'Do it yourself'...which kind of annoyed me. The last area I think management needs to look at is the television service. It is great that the hotel provides two tv's for the suite.....however the quality of picture on both was below standard, as if the rabbit ears needed to be moved. I would stay here again, the pros outweigh the cons, however I felt I needed to mention them so that there could be some fine tuning with housekeeping. I see most reviewers give the complimentary breakfast a thumbs up, I however feel like it works for children who don't mind sugar cereals, white toast and choice of one daily fruit, I personally think they could do better. The $5 hot breakfast buffet is value for money and considering the continental is so disappointing, I imagine most people opt to spend the $5. I have always stayed at the Sunshine Suites however because of the above mentionned items i think I'll try the Mariott on my next visit.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel.. will be back again!!

reviews.text: Our family (husband, wife and twin 13-year old boys) enjoyed a week's stay at Sunshine Suites Resort this past month (July 2013). We found practically everything about Sunshine Suites to be as good as the excellent reviews promised. The proximity to the beach was perfect ... a short stroll across the street and down a gravel path past the Westin Causarina put us smack in the middle of a beautiful beach. Steps away was Red Sail Water Sports (down near Governor's Beach) where we were able to rent kayaks, sail boat, take a "banana boat" ride and more.
reviews.title: Relaxing Family Vacation in the Heart of Seven Mile Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast at Sunshine Grill was included in our room rate and our stay coincided with a change to free continental breakfast and a new ala carte menu. We did not try the ala carte breakfast, but did have the breakfast buffet which we found to be more than adequate. Towels and beach chairs for the beach were readily available and convenient. We brought a small insulated bag to bring water, soft drinks, fruit and snack to the beach each day.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Darryn, the manager of the Sunshine Grill, generously spent a fair amount time with us mapping out highlights of the island on the day we rented a car. Katie, at the Front Desk, was helpful and pleasant with getting my return boarding passes printed. I used the on-site laundry facilities half-way through (Front Desk provided CI quarters in exchange for my US bills), which was great ... allowing us to pack light and still have fresh clothing for our stay.
reviews.title: Great value, excellent customer service

reviews.text: We all agreed that the best meals we had on the island were our dinners at the Sunshine Grill. The food is fresh, wonderfully and creatively prepared and generous. Drinks from the bar were most delicious as well, thanks to Danielle (Nicole?). We loved the mini ice cream cone offered after meals ... my favorite flavor was the Mango-Lemon with Ginger (I think it was called).
reviews.title: GREAT place to stay

reviews.text: The staff are all welcoming, pleasant and helpful. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would return to Grand Cayman and Sunshine Suites in a New York minute!
reviews.title: Great value, perfect location - would definitely return!

reviews.text: If you don't mind the 200 yard walk to the beach then look no further then the sunshine suites. The rooms are on the smaller side but have all the amenities you need. They also have one of the best restaurants on the island the sunshine grill. I'd like to thank everyone who made our anniversary stay a memorable one and we hope to be back in the near future.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel.

reviews.text: The facility is immaculate and the rooms are clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and cordial. This was our first time to the island and we were not sure how to book activities. Upon arrival we asked at check-in for suggestions and the staff recommended a few activities and booked our reservation at that time. Everything they recommended was wonderful. The towels and chairs offered by the facility were nice amenities. We rented the bikes offered by the hotel and that was a great way to get to downtown without the hassle of getting a cab. Very close to some nice shops on your way to downtown too. The resturant at the hotel, Sunshine Grill is, for lack of a better word, amazing! We dined at a few restaurants in town, however nothing was close to this place. I tried almost every item on the menu, and each was unique and delicious. From the Havana chicken sandwich to the burger (yes a burger on an island in the Caribbean) were tremendous. No pretenses here just great food at a reasonable price. We loved our first trip to Grand Cayman, the island is beautiful, and our stay at Sunshine Suites was the tower on our sandcastle.
reviews.title: Great value for a great vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed one week at Sunshine Suites resort on Grand Cayman. Nice friendly staff, clean room, well kept property. Beach towels and chair were avaiable to use and you can exchange for clean towels as needed. We used the rinse tanks for our scuba gear. A continental/plus breakfast was included in our package which got us of to a good start. We cooked in our room one night for dinner. A couple nights we went to the restraunt that is onsite. People we were diving with said it has the best burgers and fish tacos. Both of the meals we had were very nice. Since we were staying in the hotel we could go back to our room and they would call when they had a table for us.
reviews.title: Comfortable and affordable stay

reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Sunshine Suites for 7 nights. We all enjoyed it and the room while not the latest and greatest, they are a decent size and really clean. The full size fridge and small kitchenette was a plus for our family. We were able to prepare some small lunch meals for the kids. The breakfast at the Sunshine Grill is fantastic and the staff is really friendly. The front desk staff could not have been more accommodating and helpful. The grounds are nicely kept and there are chairs around to sit during the day or after dinner. Being across the street from the beach was not a big deal at all. We didn't mind the walk or we drove because we had a car and with kids there's always a ton of water toys. The beach by the Governors house is beautiful and one of the nicest I think on the island. It's super clean and there are not man rocks, while other beaches we visited had some rocks. Great stay! Will return for sure.
reviews.title: Great place to stay with family & kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I chose Sunshine Suites in Grand Cayman for our honeymoon and had a fantastic time! Location is great- beach is directly across the street, staff are very helpful, and the room was fantastic.
reviews.title: Great place to honeymoon!

reviews.text: I took my family to the Caymans for vacation. We decided to stay at Sunshine Suites in order to save money. We were glad to see that the reviews were right on point. Staff was extremely pleasent and the food at the Sunshine Grill was Amazing. But our favorite part of our stay was PACO. He is a black cat who is also a mascot for the hotel. Wednesday morning while ground maintainance was going on, Paco decided to meow outside our door so we let him in. Paco then followed us everytime we came back to the hotel. I even have a picture of Paco in our suitcase.
reviews.title: B.V.E. Best vacation ever..

reviews.text: Stayed six nights, wish it could have been six months! The staff at Sunshine Suites, from the front desk, restaurant, grounds keepers and housekeeping are all top notch! Very friendly and truly are happy you are there! I met my daughter and her friend there for an all girls retreat. The hotel room is comfortable, clean and the kitchenette is a lifesaver as it is very expensive on the island to eat out. Walk down to the grocery store and stock up on snacks, lunch items and drinks. The hotel provides you with dishes and pots and pans. Bring your own bags to the grocery store as they charge you if you need them to provide you plastic (biodegradable ones!) bags. The grounds are impeccable at the hotel and the restaurant is very reasonably priced and delicious. The beach is a quick walk across the street and is absolutely beautiful. Met some very friendly families on the beach which makes it all that more enjoyable. I was worried about carrying my 70 lb. suitcase up the 3 flights of stairs, but not to worry they offered to help and sent a young man who carried it up for me. I was happy to tip him $5! Will definitely stay at Sunshine Suites again if I make it back to Grand Cayman!
reviews.title: Ahhhhhhh....... wish I was still there!

reviews.text: This is a great property and value. We spent 10 days here and were either diving or spending time at the beach/pool. We felt it was perfect size for the 3 of us (2 adults & a teen). Our bed was VERY comfortable. This is a rare find. Our teen was happy to have his own space at night & pulled out the hide-a-bed. The STAFF at this hotel was WONDERFUL. They were helpful with all kinds of questions we had about the island. The Sunshine Grill was also very tasty and service was great! We tried a lot of different items on the menu and they were all delicious! We went to the grocery store to fill our fridge and cupboards with snacks/drinks which was a few blocks away. The morning breakfast was also very convenient and delicious. Beautiful property, convenient laundry facilities, short walk to 7 mile beach (you cross a busy road but most locals would stop for you), nice pool, etc. Went to the World Gym which has an agreement with Sunshine (3 miles away via bus $3 one way) 3 times during my stay and ran on the beach the other days. Tips: buy beach umbrella at Cost You Less. The beach area is not shady so be prepared to bring something to have relief from the sun if you need it. The hotel doesn't have umbrellas but they have nice chairs and towels they will let you use during your stay. A lot of the time we came back to the hotel wet from diving or from the beach - because the rooms don't have a balcony or chairs to set things on to dry outside I would suggest bringing a laundry line to hang over the tub area. We felt bad having so many things wet in our room but not having enough room or a place to hang the items. In talking with the Sunshine Suites I mentioned this and they actually said they had the laundry lines on order so maybe call before you go to see if they have them yet (if not, bring something - it will help you dry your things out). Our maid was great to always make sure we had what we needed. We would return for another visit for sure. What a beautiful place and the people on the Island are VERY friendly and helpful. We felt safe and secure staying here. Speed bumps in the parking lot at night were a little hazardous. Wish they could paint them yellow with reflector paint or stickers for the visitors that frequent the parking lot (we almost tripped on them several times because at night it was hard to tell where they were until we got used to the road). The internet was reliable most if not all of the time - it wasn't a big deal really. Yes, it's a little slow to load but it works. You are on vacation so how much wifi to you really need all of the time? We were able to log in to our email, iMessage & Facebook daily with no real problems. Wonderful vacation!! Hope to return soon!
reviews.title: First time to Cayman

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and i wanted to get away for a week! Just the two of us. This was the right choice!!! The island is beautiful. The staff was very helpfull and friendly at all times. They helped us with booking some excursions and getting arround the island! We only had breakfast in the hotel, because we did not wanted to be stuck on eating times from the hotel. The breakfast had everything it needed. So a good start of the day! We can only say thank you to all the staff, for this unforgettable holiday!
reviews.title: great get away!!!

reviews.text: I brought my 3 sons (my 15 year old on his first dive) to grand cayman for an 8 day stay at the Sunshine suites and could not have been happier with our stay. Every one associated with the hotel was very nice and helpful(front desk,cleaning staff, staff at the restaraunt, security staff). Room was a little smaller than I expected for a one bedroom, but it worked out well for the 4 of us. Any person that complains about walking across the road to get to the beach is a slug!!! Having the Ritz and the Westin across the beach was nice as well. Rode jet skies twice at Red Sails (at the Westin) and had a blast. From now on I will only stay at the Sunshine suites when in Grand Cayman!
reviews.title: Ist time on 7 mile beach
These reviews are right
reviews.text: When looking for a place to stay in the Cayman Island, we read all the reviews to find the best place at the right price, because you never know. We picked the Sunshine Suites and we made the right choice. These reviews are correct. The 6 of us felt right at home here, enjoyed the breakfast, close enough to the 7 mile beach, and all at a good price. Sure you can spend alot more for beachfront and fancy, but we didn't need to. I would go there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In One word--Clean. Grounds like a golf course. Rooms spotless. Rooms looked new. Pleasant staff. Very reasonable price. Has best lunch restaurant on island. Find best Sunshine Suites room price online with major travel agencies; then call Sunshine Suites directly at their 800 number; they will match price and give a food and beverage credit for booking directly. We will stay there again next time. Also try Eats/Legenz (connected and same menu/price) in Cayman Falls shopping center on main road in front of Sunshine Suites.
reviews.title: Great Lodging Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I researched a place to celebrate our 30th anniversary since we had loved Grand Cayman so much when we visited on a cruise 15 years ago. My husband and I are so glad we didn't stick with the large hotel chains. Sunshine suites' staff, food, pool, etc. are delightful and the property is immaculate inside and out. We will definitely be returning!
reviews.title: We're so glad we found it!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Sunshine Suites last year, (forgot to write a review) and for what we paid, we were satisfied. Yes, you have to cross a busy highway to get to the lovely 7 Mile Beach. Boyfriend and I are very athletic so the short walk was no bother to us at all. We found a sale on Sunshine Suites. The price was really inexpensive, so we decided last minute to fly down. I do my research so I was not expecting a 5 star property.
reviews.title: Not bad for what we paid.

reviews.text: Boyfriend is allergic to gluten so it was great to have a full kitchen. There is a grocery store within walking distance for us. Our room was quite nice, clean, and very comfortable. We carried our own luggage to and from our room. Again, we are in shape so this was no chore at all. We found the staff at the desk to be quite personable and polite.
reviews.title: 4-starn hotel with 10-star service

reviews.text: I gave this hotel a poor rating only after repetitive stays over four years. Most people do not give this hotel a poor rating . My ratings in their Trip advisers chart for sleep quality , rooms Etc. we're not that bad at all . I have a lot of positive things to say about this hotel . First of all if you've never been to the Cayman Islands and landed without a reservation this is without a doubt the best go to hotel call get a room any room for one night don't think about anything and you'll have a better Time than other options by far . It's really amazing what these people have done to this simple property the grounds are amazing the colors are interesting And everything is consistent every trip as far as the cleanliness of the grounds and the general look . The problem is person who set up the general look and Attitude of this hotel left years ago although they've kept his look consistent things with the staff are slowly changing . The person who manages the hotel is a good guy as you can tell by their reviews but things are changing slowly . I stay in their highest price rooms and I find them pleasant extremely clean and I swear they steam clean the loveseats often . Sometimes I ask for the same room and it's in top shape like I said but even a year later the same air-conditioner in the same room will be making a Unusual noise -like the year before. the lovely head maintenance man will come up and does the best he can . He's not in control of ordering parts so it's like living the same drama year after year . Ask for the head maintenance man if you have a problem , don't bother him as he really is a nice guy . I find some problems with some of the so-called maintenance people and some of the housecleaners. Don't get me wrong everything is very clean in the rooms. One thing to remember though is Cayman Islands used to be governed by Jamaica and their are strong family ties between the two islands. Someone from Jamaica of course bring their exact cultural ideas with them and their views of life with them so in a way it's kind of like visiting Jamaica in a small way. The good and the bad. Everyone's just ultimately trying to come to to some type of human understanding. This hotel keeps a year-to-year 24-hour strong watch over the safety of the hotel and their guests. The only concerns I ever have are when they have a fill in security guard which never bothers me and once in a while I'll get a small uneasiness about one or to of the staff it's probably just me. The pool Maintenance is exceptionally good . You will probably only notice problems with the breakfast after repetitive stays, or stays more than one or two days . The staff who work the breakfast have been the same for years and just not happy themselves and either had no or lost all respect for tourists. God bless them I hope things work out. I find the food for dinner to be excellent and consistent and they'll even give you half portions if you ask can be lots of fun. In general something about the grill just seems to be slowly fading as well. I Asked for a dark and stormy at the bar which I don't usually frequent and was given the wrong type of rum And a cheap ginger ale . The "cheap" ginger ale is understandable due to the customs cost of importing items. This drink is made with the same type of rum worldwide it Requires this rum to be called a dark and stormy.)(I sat there for 15 minutes waiting for the bartender to serve other people was really patient wondering what was wrong with my drink. I saw the drink Poured and in my best Sunday school manners asked what was wrong and could I have another drink. Was told they were out of that type of rum hey no problem at all , I just want to have fun and relax. It's the response I got that was the problem that made the fun Goaway was given another Type of drink with very little Alcohol poured in it . I was given an attitude and a weak second drink how dare I ask for what I ordered ? They just never think they're going to see you again. I get this attitude a lot on Grand Cayman they are convinced they never going to see you again and it becomes a self fulfilling prophecy I ask you even though I love Grand Cayman and will always go back the rest of my life what I'm I supposed to do. Buy a condo only go to the grocery store and hide the rest of my life. On the subject remember this is a hotel that changes their price every 15 minutes and also adds on electricity charges that other hotels do not add on to. Your bill. They also use gimmicks on the web to try to get you to sign up sign up for more rooms upgrades I don't know why ,I don't know why they do this because they are obviously highly rated. It's a weird combination of making a building that could be nothing into something spectacular having excellent grounds fun colors in a fun atmosphere but even from the top down some of the basic planning does not have loyalty to the customer in mind -even though this is a privately owned hotel . Many hotels Say they are almost full or half full and they are not even close to that. This hotel has more cars in the parking lot every time I drive by it compared to other hotels by far. So unless they're giving away rooms to friends or business partners they are definitely are doing something right compared to other hotels on the island . This review is half written for the sunshine suites and grill themselves in the hope that they can make a change like was made years ago to set up the original basis for the success of this hotel. There is a beach like no other within a short walking distance there's never any waves at the beach the water is the same 86 Degrees Fahrenheit all the time there is no crime on the beach The weather is incredibly consistent . even if the weather calls for rain just don't worry just go swimming - go down to the beach . Go try and take part in the local community but if you see some locals who look like people you wouldn't hang out with at home (Bad attitude ) drinking at the beach or are alcoholics it's best to stay away and deal with the other 95%to 98% ? of the population. I hope I have not been to wordy or straightforward about my review I'm only just trying to help best of luck . If by some chance you can tell who I am by this review once again I'm just trying to help I can see the writing on the wall Grand Cayman is going to get very busy especially your part of the island soon so I hope this helps. I just want to see everybody progress. I hope your staff and your hotel makes money and your staff is happy .
reviews.title: First time visitors, business travelers, high IQ people . Fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located at the perfect spot on seven mile beach. This was my first time visiting Cayman Islands. The hotel is located across the street from the beach with an easy quick 2 min walk. The hotel offers beach chairs at no extra cost to bring the beach was very convenient. This hotel gives you great location, service, clean rooms and half the price for staying directly on the beach. For the amount of money you can save from staying across the street from the beach is well worth it. Its perfectly located around all other major hotels which had amazing restaurants which we ate at many of nights. The only hiccup we had was I lost my cell phone at the end of our stay and realized as we checked out and they did not seem to take any care or even write a report if it was to be found to reach out to me. If i go back I would stay here again for sure.
reviews.title: Would go back in a heart beat!

reviews.text: I had a studio, with a kitchenette, microwave, full size refrig and stove. Everything I needed. The service here is excellent. If you need something, they'll give it to you or help you get it. My return flight was delayed and Katie got on the phone and arranged another flight so I could still make my connection... now that's service!
reviews.title: Superb service! Will come back again and again...

reviews.text: Darren is stellar and quite helpful.
reviews.title: Great for the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sunshine Grill is famous on the island... and it's right here! Great food and service.
reviews.title: Can't say enough about the place!

description: Sunshine Suites Resort offers the best in affordable boutique lodging. We’re a short walk from the sparkling ocean waters and white sand of Grand Cayman’s famous Seven Mile Beach. Enjoy the convenience of our prime location next to the Ritz Carlton, down the road from the 18-hole North Sound Golf Course and near dozens of shops and restaurants. Our amenities include free continental breakfast and wireless internet. We offer our guests high end accommodations, excellent services and convenience at affordable prices. Whether your visit is for business or pleasure, a warm and friendly team awaits you!
